item.title: Tupperware, no longer a kitchen staple, files for bankruptcy
item.description: Tupperware's reliance on people selling its storage containers at home-and-garden parties or through social media was once its strength. Now it's a weakness, the company says in its bankruptcy filing.

item.title: What today's interest rate cut means for you. And, a big drop in U.S. overdose deaths
item.description: The first interest rate cut since 2020 is expected to be announced today by the Federal Reserve. And, for the first time in decades, U.S. drug overdose deaths appear to be plummeting.

item.title: Lael Wilcox rode around the world and then went for another bike ride
item.description: American cyclist Lael Wilcox rode more than 18,000 miles in 108 days, 12 hours and 12 minutes. She's claiming the record for the fastest woman to ride around the world.

item.title: Georgia election officials worry a GOP-led board will OK last-minute voting changes
item.description: Georgia election officials have said they are “gravely concerned that dramatic changes” approved by the State Election Board “will disrupt the preparation and training processes already in motion.”

item.title: Meet Moo Deng, the baby pygmy hippo so popular you can visit her for only 5 minutes
item.description: A baby pygmy hippopotamus in a Thailand zoo has become a worldwide internet sensation, leading to crowds at the zoo. Zoo officials say the increased attention has led to some bad visitor behavior.

item.title: Want to keep good workers? Praise them, a new study finds
item.description: New research from Gallup and Workhuman finds that employees who receive recognition on the job are 45% less likely to leave their jobs. Younger workers, in particular, say appreciation is key.

item.title: NPR Exclusive: U.S. overdose deaths plummet, saving thousands of lives
item.description: After decades of devastating increases driven by fentanyl and other toxic street drugs, overdose deaths are dropping sharply in much of the U.S. The trend could mean roughly 20,000 fewer deaths in 2024.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: The FBI is investigating packages sent to election officials in more than 15 states
item.description: The FBI and the U.S. Postal Service were investigating the origin of suspicious packages that have been sent to elections officials in more than 15 states. There were no immediate reports of injuries.
